p: A variety of skin manifestations are associated with neurotropic viruses. A vesicular rash is found with HSV and VZV [ 27]. Enteroviruses and coxsackie virus may also have an accompanying rash on the palms of the hands, soles of the feet and inside of the mouth [ 27]. Inflamed oral mucosa, referred to as herpangina, is often associated with coxsackie virus, HSV and adenovirus [ 27]. A slapped cheek appearance in association with fever and headache is due to fifth disease, also called erythema infectiosum, caused by human parvovirus B19 [ 28]. Roseola infantum (sixth disease) has a morbiliform rash and is caused by HHV-6 [ 29]. An eschar from a tick bite may be hidden in the hairline or groin, between the fingers or toes, or even in the ear canal. Measles has a typical maculopapular rash [ 10].
